comment: She is the one of the best professors i have ever had
Very rude, doesn't give good feedback or answer emails, and she talks down to students.

I liked the format of her class in that the main focus was discussing case studies. Be prepared and read the case studies and participate. You'll get so much more out of class if you do. Group project was very relevant to the business world. I wish there were more of this type of project throughout the curriculum.

She is an awesome professor, and is very easy on the eyes! She does show up to class late and actually did keep us late a few times, but I can forgive her for that. She is not the type of professor who gives you easy grades because of effort, but her grading is still fair. You will also get a good participation grade just for showing up.

Takes forever to grade your assignments, does not provide good feedback, shows up late to class. She shows are clear lack of focus for teaching. Does not explain material well, does not explain assignments well, and her tests are notoriously not what you studied for.

She's very knowledgeable about course content but she isn't a terribly good lecturer. Confusing at times and is ALWAYS late to class. She even missed the first day of class because she "forgot". Takes forever to respond to emails and takes even longer to give you your grades back. Frustrating professor overall.
not at all helpful
She expects you to be prepared for class, read the notes and be attentive in class. Her teaching style requires being involved. Do your work, come to class, and you will be fine

Our 4 week summer class was changed to a hybrid.  We only met 2x/wk - review and exam.  She assigns a research paper in lieu of final.  The book was very technical...felt like I needed to be an IT major instead of IS.  STUDY THE REVIEW QUESTIONS.  Her teaching style tends to be dry and boring.  Horrible at answering emails.  Always late to class.
This women does not teach ,the book is your teacher.She expects the world and is not very helpful or clear.

She knows her stuff and expects students to be prepared in class. A lot of emphasis on case studies and class discussions which helps in understanding the material. Very helpful in and out of the class.
She is one of the best professors! She requires a lot of work but the discussions of the cases are engaging and useful

Dr. Sneha is both imperious and capricious in her interactions with students. She takes a long time to grade assignments and when she does they arrive with cryptic or useless feedback. She cancels class on a whim and doesn't respond to email. Dr. Sneha teaches a required course, so you have to take her. Know what you're in for.

She is certainly the most incompetent professor in the MSIS program. She has the students teach the class through tons of presentations so she doesn't have to teach.  She is so unorganized that she lost my paper so she just gave me an A instead of grading it.  This class is a joke, I learned nothing, and had to do 4 presentations throughthe year
she is just a waste of time. never advise anyone to take her class.she doenot kow her material. just read from ppt. aways try to pay attention to her dresses.

The material is dry and dated but she taught through it well and knew the material she was teaching, which was directly from the book.  Email reply's could have come sooner, more details to assignments, etc.. She grades on attendance also, so show up and make a presence and you'll do fine.

Sneha isn't too hard but she can be pretty anal. If you leave class early or don't show up, she notices. She often seemed irritated with the students. And don't expect her to respond to emails. The tests aren't too bad but you and a partner have to do one presentation in front of the class and turn in a paper at the end of the semester.
Very engaging teaching style and classroom discussions. One of the classes where everyone participated
She seems hard at first but if you pay attention and do the project..ask for feedback she will help you. very caring professor
HOT, HOT, HOT, HOT, HOT...HOT...she gives you what you need to pass the class.

Fun teacher. Group events and projects were assigned through out the entire semester. So you must do atleast one presentation in front of the class. Study guides were given before the test and hand picked from the guide. Come to class and participate and its an easy grade.

she seems impossible on the first class but she is actually a very engaging teacher and she gives you the necessary info to make an A in her class. She seams very hard but she is actually medium to easy if you know how to PLAY THE GAME.

Again, more of the entitlement generation expecting to be spoon fed and then coming here to deliver bad ratings. She puts the majority of the work required to learn the content into students' hands.  You will get out exactly what you put into one of her classes. And the comment below about pronouncing her name? Not true. Good story, though.

AVOID! Grade is completely arbitrary! She says she will lower your grade if you mispronounce her name. Can't teach (reads from her powerpoint slides). And when she gets bored of teaching (2 weeks in), she assigns students to teach the chapters and grades you on it.  And forget about trying to get in touch with her outside of class, it's impossible.

This is one of the worst teachers I have ever had. She has no knowledge of the subject matter, and it shows when all she does is read pre-made power point slides.  She has been frequently late to class and the group project is a huge joke. Overall the class has felt like the biggest waste of time in my life and I would not recommend her to annyone.
